SEARCH
Package util

Class ColorInConsole

java.lang.Object
util.ColorInConsole
public class ColorInConsole extends Object
Utility class that provides ANSI escape codes to print colored text and backgrounds in the console. Useful for adding visual emphasis or styling console outputs.

Note: These escape codes work in terminals that support ANSI colors (e.g., most Unix terminals). They may not work in the standard Windows Command Prompt without additional configuration.

Example usage: 

 System.out.println(ColorInConsole.Red + "Error message" + ColorInConsole.Reset);

  • Method Details

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the terminal and resets the cursor to the top-left. This sends a couple of special ANSI codes to the terminal: one to clear the screen, and one to move the cursor back to the beginning. Works great in most modern terminals. Might not work perfectly in very old Windows consoles.
